section.name: The command line
section.p: The only user interface of Eoulsan is the command line. The syntax and the available options can be get using the following command :
The program show you the following output:
section.source: usage: eoulsan [options] action arguments -about display information about this software -conf <file> configuration file to use -h,--help display this help -j <path> JAVA_HOME path -J <args> JVM arguments (-server by default) -license display information about the license of this software -log <file> external log file -loglevel <level> log level -m <size> maximal memory usage for JVM in MB (4096 by default) -p <classpath> additional classpath for eoulsan plugins -s <property=value> set a configuration setting. This option can be used several times -version show version of the software Available actions: - emrexec execute eoulsan on Amazon Elastic MapReduce service. - createdesign create a design file from a list of files. - createhadoopjar create a jar file for hadoop with all dependencies include. - exec execute Eoulsan in local mode. - hadoopexec execute Eoulsan on local hadoop cluster.

ul.li: emrexec: Upload data and launch Eoulsan analysis on Amazon Web Services cloud.
exec: Launch Eoulsan analysis in local mode.
hadoopexec: Launch Eoulsan analysis on a Hadoop cluster.
createdesign: Create a design file from a list of fastq, gff and fasta files.
createhadoopjar: Create an Eoulsan jar file that contains all jar dependencies. This jar file can be used to run manualy Eoulsan on a Hadoop cluster (local or in Amazon Web Services cloud).

section.p: You can display general help and specific help about an action using -h argument.

subsection.name: -about
subsection.p: When you run Eoulsan with this option, you will get information about Eoulsan authors and then returns to the shell.

subsection.name: -conf <file>
subsection.p: With this option, Eoulsan will load the file as configuration file. See the configuration section for more information.

subsection.name: -s <property=value>
subsection.p: With this option, Eoulsan will set a specific setting. Usage of this option override settings loaded in configuration file. Key and value of the setting are separated by the '=' character. This option can be used several times in command line. See the configuration section for more information.

subsection.name: -j <path>
subsection.p: This option allow to define the path to the JVM to use for running Eoulsan.

subsection.name: -J <args>
subsection.p: Define the JVM options when running Eoulsan. The default value is "-server".

subsection.name: -license
subsection.p: When you run Eoulsan with this option, you will get information about Eoulsan license and and then returns to the shell.

subsection.name: -loglevel <level>
subsection.p: Set the log level, there are 5 log level define in Eoulsan : Severe, Warning, Info, Fine and all. By default the log level is set to Info.

subsection.name: -m <size>
subsection.p: Define the maximal size in megabytes that can be allocated by the JVM. The default value is 4096.

subsection.name: -p <classpath>
subsection.p: Define additional classpath for Eoulsan plug-ins or dependencies.

subsection.name: -version
subsection.p: When you run Eoulsan with this option, you will get information about Eoulsan version and then Eoulsan returns to the shell.

section.name: Environment variables
section.p: In order to avoid modify the eoulsan.sh file, you use the following environment variable to configure Eoulsan JVM and plugins path:

ul.li: EOULSAN_JAVA_HOME: The path to the JDK to use with Eoulsan. If this environment variable is not set the JAVA_HOME environment varibale will be used. If none of this environment variables is set, the default java command will be used to launch Eoulsan.
EOULSAN_MEMORY: The maximum size in MiB of the JVM memory allocation pool. Default value is 4096.
EOULSAN_JVM_OPTS: The JVM options. Default value is "-server".
EOULSAN_PLUGINS: The path to Eoulsan plugins. No default value is set.
